ccre.channel

Interface SerialOutput

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SerialIO

    public interface SerialOutput
    An interface to write to a generic serial output. Usually RS232. WARNING: THIS INTERFACE IS SUBJECT TO NON-BACKWARDS-COMPATIBLE CHANGE.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the serial port.
      void flush()
      Flush any remaining output as far down to the hardware as possible.
      void setFlushOnWrite(boolean flushOnWrite)
      Sets whether or not data should be flushed immediately when written as opposed to waiting for a full buffer or a call to flush.
      void writeFully(byte[] bytes, int from, int to)
      Write the entire byte section.
      int writePartial(byte[] bytes, int from, int to)
      Write an appropriately-sized chunk of the byte section, and return the number of bytes actually written.

    • Method Detail

      • flush

        void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Flush any remaining output as far down to the hardware as possible. This will send any buffered data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while flushing.

      • setFlushOnWrite

        void setFlushOnWrite(boolean flushOnWrite)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets whether or not data should be flushed immediately when written as opposed to waiting for a full buffer or a call to flush.
        Parameters:
        flushOnWrite - if data should be flushed immediately.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while changing the setting.

      • writeFully

        void writeFully(byte[] bytes,
              int from,
              int to)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Write the entire byte section.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to write a section from.
        from - the start of the section.
        to - the end of the section.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while writing the data.

      • writePartial

        int writePartial(byte[] bytes,
               int from,
               int to)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Write an appropriately-sized chunk of the byte section, and return the number of bytes actually written.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to write a section from.
        from - the start of the section.
        to - the end of the section.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while writing the data.

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the serial port. It may not be used after this is invoked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while the port was being closed.
